page.title: 13Farming.
page.content: At the time of writing the lot of the dairy farmer is governed to a large extent by milk quotas and prices set by the E.E.C.The arable farmer,on the other hand,can sell to anyone for the best price he can get.With the use of chemical fertilisers and help from the weather Mr.Dickinson has pushed his yield per acre up from one and a quarter tons to three tons.Following the planting the first pest to attack the crop is mildew.This is followed by leather jackets(crane fly lava).Chemical sprays and slug pellets are used to attack these.In the Spring fertiliser(nitrogen) is added to the crop.Harvesting begins in July with the winter barley,followed by oats and wheat.Often farmers work up to nineteen hours a day during harvest time.crops are rotated to preserve the goodness in the soil.
